outputs.name: model
outputs.description:
A Dragonfly Model object possessing all of the input geometry
objects.

inputs.name: _buildings
inputs.description:
A list of Dragonfly Building objects to be added to the Model.
Note that at least one Building is necessary to make a simulate-able
energy model.

inputs.name: context_
inputs.description: Optional Dragonfly ContextShade objects to be added to the Model.

inputs.name: _name_
inputs.description:
Text to be used for the name and identifier of the Model. If no
name is provided, it will be "unnamed".

code:
try:  # import the core honeybee dependencies
    from honeybee.typing import clean_string, clean_and_id_string
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import honeybee:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:  # import the core dragonfly dependencies
    from dragonfly.model import Model
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import dragonfly:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.{{plugin}} import all_required_inputs
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.config import units_system, tolerance, angle_tolerance
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import ladybug_{{cad}}:\n\t{}'.format(e))


if all_required_inputs(ghenv.Component):
    # set a default name
    name = clean_string(_name_) if _name_ is not None else clean_and_id_string('unnamed')
    units = units_system()

    # create the model
    model = Model(name, _buildings, context_, units=units, tolerance=tolerance,
                  angle_tolerance=angle_tolerance)
    model.display_name = _name_ if _name_ is not None else 'unnamed'
name: DF Model
description:
Create a Dragonfly Model, which can be translated to Honeybee model and sent
for simulation.
-
